front.title: A generic fragment identifier syntax for URI references

abstract.t: URI references with fragment identifiers uniquely identify parts of adocument. Such identifiers have been specified as SGML/XML IDs e.g.in HTML [6]. The XPointer [2] specification is intended to serve asa fragment identifier syntax for XML documents. IDs conform to theXPointer 'raw name' form. Specifications constraining the behaviorof user agents such as SMIL [8], XHTML [15], and SVG [10] have allsupported this simple fragment naming convention though some extendit.
